title: The recreations of Christopher North
author: Wilson, John
snippet: This was a horse-cloth with which we had intended to saddle the " cowle," and that had remained, during the supernatural agency under which we laboured, clutched unconsciously and convulsively in our grasp. ^<ong was it ere Davie Donald would see us in our true light — but at length he drew on his Kilmarnock nightcap, and, coming out with a bouet, let us through the trance and out of the front door, thoroughly convinced, till we read Bewick, that old Southfield was not dead, although in a very bad way indeed. Let this be a lesson to schoolboys not to neglect the science of natural history, and to study the character of the While Owl.
